A few days passed since Inori and I got used to\nspending time as lovers.%K%P
Now, Inori was almost always by my side.%K%P
'Here you go, Sho.'%K%P
'Thanks.'%K%P
Inori served me a bowl of rice.%K%P
It was the perfect portion, as always.%K%P
'You've become so accustomed to it, it's like\nyou're his wife.'%K%P
Maika commented as she gazed at Inori, briskly\ntaking care of me.%K%P
'N-N-Not at all! I'm still far from you, Maika!'%K%P
'It's true, I think Maika's food is still\ntastier.'%K%P
'She's learned most of the dishes I taught her,\nit's only a matter of time I'll be surpassed by\nInori.'%K%P
Maika responded to Akane as she slurped down\nmiso soup.%K%P
'I have to say that I agree with Maika.'%K%P
'It's already impressive how she improved so\nmuch in such a short amount of time.'%K%P
In reality, Inori had greatly improved on all\nher chores in general.%K%P
Was it because she was able to work more\nefficiently?%K%P
'It's all because of my mentor, Maika. Thank you\nfor everything.'%K%P
'The more people know how to cook, the easier it\ngets for me. Now that Inori cooks, I'm able to\nrelax more.'%K%P
'It's true that her food is tasting better.\nYeah, anyway, I'm not complaining.'%K%P
'Oh please, Akane.'%K%P
'I get to eat delicious food and Inori feels the\njoy in cooking. What an awesome relationship!'%K%P
Forcing a smile at Akane, Inori seemed pretty\nhappy.%K%P
It's always nice to feel accomplished.%K%P
'Speaking of chores, it's been raining a lot\nrecently.'%K%P
'Yes. The laundry won't dry if it's always\ncloudy like this.'%K%P
'It's true. It makes a huge difference in\nsoftness when drying it under the sun rather\nthan in the room.'%K%P
Inori and Maika started to sound like house\nwives with their concerns.%K%P
'It was rainy and cloudy all last week. I wonder\nhow next week's looking.'%K%P
I took the remote to turn on the TV just when\nthey were about to start the weather report.%K%P
'The typhoon is gathering strength...'%K%P
'What, another one?'%K%P
Akane sounded disappointed as she watched the\nnews.%K%P
'We're in the season, but it sure is happening a\nlot these days.'%K%P
'Augh, I'm bored. Staying at home all the time\nis gonna make me gloomy.'%K%P
'There's nothing you can do about the weather.'%K%P
Akane sulked like a child and Inori gently\ncalmed her down.%K%P
It's like they were mother and child.%K%P
If I married Inori and we had a kid, she would\nbe a wonderful mother.%K%P
'Sh-Sho? When you stare at me like that, it's,\nyou know, embarrassing.'%K%P
'Sorry. I was just thinking how you'd be a good\nmom.'%K%P
'A-A mom?! U-Um, I think that's too early for\nus...'%K%P
'But if that's what you want, I can start\nnow...!'%K%P
'Hey, Sho. I think something weird's going on\nwith Inori.'%K%P
'There, there. I'm still a student so it'd be\ntoo early for me. I need to get a good job first\ntoo.'%K%P
If we were to have kids, I'd need to establish a\ngood foundation for Inori.%K%P
'Sho, you're acting weird too.'%K%P
Next to us acting silly, Maika was watching the\nnews with a serious face.%K%P
'Maika? Is there something going on in the\nnews?'%K%P
'Ah, I'm just worried about the typhoon.'%K%P
'What typhoon?'%K%P
I shifted my attention to the news.%K%P
'The typhoon will touchdown in four days and\nit's looking to be a big one.'%K%P
The reporter on TV read the rest of the\nforecast.%K%P
I figured out what Maika wanted to say.%K%P
'It's almost time to prepare for the Autumn\nFestival, right? It's unfortunate to have such a\nbig typhoon hit this year.'%K%P
'It sounds like it's a big one too. They might\neven cancel the Autumn Festival.'%K%P
Kannagi's Autumn Festival requires a month of\npreparation and then a week of intense\npreparation.%K%P
Each district gathers and makes ropes for the\nparade, rehearse dances, collects donations, and\narranges the food.%K%P
During the last stretch of the preparations,\nthere's more labor including setting up risers\nand moving the portable shrine to city hall.%K%P
The month long preparation for this year was\ndone. What was left was the week of intense\npreparation.%K%P
We understood that there was the potential for\nall that hard work to become ruined by the\ntyphoon.%K%P
'If it gets canceled, everyone in town would be\nso disappointed.'%K%P
'Is the Autumn Festival going to be okay?'%K%P
Inori and Akane asked as they sensed the anxiety\nfrom Maika and I.%K%P
'The neighborhood association must have an\nalternative plan in place, so it should be\nfine.'%K%P
'Yup... And we're the ones who need to reinforce\nTsubaki so it doesn't fall apart.'%K%P
Still anxious about the Autumn Festival, we\nstarted to prepare for the typhoon.%K%P
